availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Poyntz Coons (Mason County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, attorney. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles B. Coons and Nancy Coons. Married to Louisa Diltz Coons on October 12, 1864 in Bracken County, Kentucky. Father of Adda Coons. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Household employed Milton Payton as wood sawyer in 1850. Attended Centre College Law School in Boyle County from 1858 to 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in 1860. Attorney in Mason County in 1863.
